channel.title: Help me Please!
channel.description:
Everytime i go to start my run server i get this error, i have edited my compiler so it has the correct path but it still wont help, can some please help.
[IMG]http://i280.photobucket.com/albums/kk186/flyer0101/error21.png[/img]

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I have had this problem with clients as well, however it’s fixed by executing a different file. I searched in the compiler sticky and I found the same problem you have.

Private message me with your teamviewer details and I can take a look; sorry I haven’t found an exact solution…I haven’t messed with this kind of stuff in months.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Yeah, i’ve also had this with one client. I loved it lol, but i had that error like 6 times, what i did was re extract it all, but when i did that, of course you lose everything it just sets it back to normal. But it kept on going back so i just said the hell with this and am using a different source+client. OR trying to >.> noob compilers lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @flyer flyer
item.description:
@flyer wrote:

well ive had this error on windows xp with a client one time, then the owner told me to edit a file in the client files and the error worked im sure there can be some solution, i also get this with every client i download and try to play.

Read full topic

Windows 7 is probably the problem.

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Do you have teamviewer?

@echo off java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

Try replacing it with that, but I am not sure why it’s throwing that error when it’s executing ‘server’.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @flyer flyer
item.description:
@flyer wrote:

this is whats inside of the batch

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Read full topic

item.title: Help me Please!
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

It would be nice if you provided more details on this. Are you sure you are running a server and not a client? If so, try executing the server class (server.java) instead of the client class (client.java):

java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

Post what is inside of your batch file here, and I can try and help you. Make sure that you are trying to run a server, not a client. Also make sure you are running a 317 server, not a 508+.

Read full topic
